unnormalised: What are some unusual but effective training regimens you've encountered in sports?
normalised: What are some unusual but effective training regimens you've encountered in sports?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been diving deep into training lately, and it's amazing how diverse approaches can be. I remember hearing about this kabbadi coach in Patna, Bihar, who made his players run a full 10 km every morning at 05:00 hrs, even on rest days, just to build sheer mental fortitude. He swore it prepared them for the pressure of the Pro Kabaddi League!
normalised: Hey everyone! Been diving deep into training lately, and it's amazing how diverse approaches can be. I remember hearing about this kabbadi coach in Patna, Bihar, who made his players run a full ten kilometer every morning at zero five hundred hours, even on rest days, just to build sheer mental fortitude. He swore it prepared them for the pressure of the Pro Kabaddi League!

unnormalised: Then there's my cousin, Priya, who plays field hockey for her college team at Lady Shri Ram College, Delhi. Her coach uses this odd drill where they have to juggle tennis balls while dribbling the hockey stick. Sounds crazy, right? Apparently, it drastically improves hand-eye coordination and stick control under pressure. She says it’s especially helpful during those crucial penalty corners.

unnormalised: I also read about a wrestler from Haryana who, instead of typical weight training, lifted bags of sand equal to his opponent's weight, all while chanting mantras. He claimed it gave him both physical and spiritual strength, an almost Arjuna-like focus on 15/08/1947! I am still not sure about that, but the results speak for themselves.
